Uses of Class
gamePackage.Player

  • Uses of Player in gamePackage

    Subclasses of Player in gamePackage
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    Computer
    The Computer class represents a player that is a computer player.
    class 
    Human
    The Human class represents a player that is a human player.
    Methods in gamePackage that return Player
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Player
    Game.getHighestStood()
    Finds the player who has chosen to 'stand' with the largest value under 21.
    Player
    Game.getLoser()
    Returns the loser of the game.
    Player
    Game.getWinner()
    Returns the winner of the game.
    Methods in gamePackage that return types with arguments of type Player
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    ArrayList<Player>
    Game.getPlayers()
    Returns the ArrayList of players.
    Methods in gamePackage with parameters of type Player
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    UserInterface.computerCardReveal(Player player, Game game)
    Function to redraw all of the computer's cards the right way up, which is called when the game is over, to let the player see what cards the computer had.
    void
    UserInterface.computerStatusMessage(String statusMessage, Player player)
    Function to show a message under the computer's hand of cards, showing status of what the computer is doing (such as 'making a choice' or 'drawing another card').
    void
    UserInterface.computerStoodMessage(Player player, String message)
    Function to display a message next to a computer's name if they have chosen to "stand".
    void
    UserInterface.computerTotalMessage(String totalMessage, Player player)
    Function to show a message telling the computer's total hand value.
    void
    Game.dealAnother(Player player)
    Calls dealCard() function for the player.
    void
    Game.dealCard(Player player)
    Generates a random number between 0 and 51, to select a random card (from deck of 52) to issue to the player.
    void
    UserInterface.displayImage(int imageNo, Player player, Game game)
    Function to display a card image.
    void
    Game.gameOver(String winnerOrLoser, Player who)
    Function called to end the game when a player has won or gone bust.
    void
    Game.handleAce(Player player)
    If a player has one or multiple aces, determines all possible values of their hand of cards, and if at least one value falls under 21, an ace Choice function is called to ask them to choose.
    void
    Game.hitOrStand(Player player)
    Asks players, if they are a human player, if they want to 'hit' (and draw another card) or 'stand' with the cards they have.
    void
    Game.humanAceChoice(Player player, ArrayList<Integer> possibleValues)
    Asks for the human player's choice when they have an Ace, or several aces.
    void
    UserInterface.humanStoodMessage(Player player, String message)
    Function to display a message next to a human player's name if they have chosen to "stand".
    void
    UserInterface.humanTotalMessage(String totalMessage, Player player)
    Function to show a message telling the human player's total hand value.
    void
    UserInterface.scoreTotalMessage(String totalMessage, Player player)
    Function to take a message of a player's total hand value, determine if the player is a computer or human player and call upon either computerTotalMessage() or humanTotalMessage() to display the message in the appropriate location.
    void
    Game.setLoser(Player loser)
    Sets the loser of the game.
    void
    Game.setWinner(Player winner)
    Sets the winner of the game.
    void
    UserInterface.showPlayerName(Player player)
    Function to show the names of the players on the screen.
    void
    UserInterface.stoodMessage(Player player, String message)
    Function to display a message next to a player's name if they have chosen to "stand".
    void
    Game.winnerOrLoser(String winnerOrLoser, Player who)
    Function called from gameOver() to identify winner and loser.
